intro: Pouteria estoriensis, commonly known as the Estoríes pouteria, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers. The tree produces smooth, round fruits that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Its wood is valued for its density and workability, making it useful in construction and furniture-making. The plant also has medicinal uses in some traditional healing practices.
